revision:
Division algorithm for polynomials

  1. If p(x)=Dividend, g(x)=Divisor, q(x)=Quotient and r(x)=Remainder then p(x) = g(x) \(\times \) q(x) + r(x), this is called the division algorithm for polynomials.
  2. If in the expression, p(x) = g(x) \(\times \) q(x) + r(x); the remainder r(x)=0 then g(x) and q(x) are the factors of the polynomial p(x).
